alert.note: Alert for Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 8:16AM PDT by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Monterey County through 900 AM PDT... At 815 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles south of Colman Canyon, or 13 miles east of Gorda, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Colman Canyon and portions of Fort Hunter Liggett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Santa Lucia Mountains and Los Padres National Forest; Southern Salinas Valley, Arroyo Seco and Lake San Antonio
